definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: She also didn’t seem to be enjoying herself much; her face was red and she was crying.
sentences.chinese: 她自己看起來也沒那麼享受，臉龐發紅還流着淚。

sentences.english: The boss is delighted, he's been all over the works dishing out bonuses and handshakes.
sentences.chinese: 老闆高興了，他走遍全廠分發紅包，與每個人握手。

sentences.english: The evening sky is red, long shot of laughter.
sentences.chinese: 黃昏天發紅，漁翁笑聲隆。

sentences.english: Her delicate face flushed pink, her lips pouted softly, as if she were going to cry.
sentences.chinese: 她的臉激動的發紅，輕輕地撅着嘴，彷彿要哭似的。

sentences.english: The phenomenon of red appear urethral mouth should distinguish between view.
sentences.chinese: 出現尿道口發紅的現象應區分看待。

sentences.english: I never experienced blisters but I did have some red peeling skin that was pretty itchy.
sentences.chinese: 我從來沒有經歷過水泡但我的確有發紅脫皮並且奇癢。

sentences.english: His angry, red face became white with fear.
sentences.chinese: 他那張本來氣得發紅的臉由於害怕而變得發白。

sentences.english: Also inspect the opening of the ear canal for discharge, swelling, or redness.
sentences.chinese: 還視察外耳道孔的排寫物，腫脹，或發紅。

sentences.english: She began to flush with excitement.
sentences.chinese: 她由於激動臉開始發紅。

sentences.english: She was pale; her eyes were red; the candle which she carried trembled in her hand.
sentences.chinese: 她面色蒼白，眼睛發紅，手裏拿着蠟燭，顫個不停。

sentences.english: You have a little fever and your eyes are red but your blood pressure is alright.
sentences.chinese: 你有些發燒而且眼睛發紅但是你的血壓卻很正常。

sentences.english: Other activities include lighting firecrackers and giving money in red paper envelopes.
sentences.chinese: 其他活動包括放鞭炮，還有發紅包。

sentences.english: Mr. Wang's face turned scarlet, and the guests all stared uncomfortably at their bowls and chopsticks.
sentences.chinese: 汪先生的臉開始發紅，客人都侷促地注視各自的碗筷。

sentences.english: If your eyes are even a bit irritated, try natural eye-drops.
sentences.chinese: 如果你的眼睛會發紅，試一試天然眼藥水。

sentences.english: An infection also can make the eardrum red.
sentences.chinese: 骨膜也會因感染而發紅。

sentences.english: 3 and in the morning, `Today it will be stormy, for the sky is red and overcast.
sentences.chinese: 早晨天發紅，又發黑，你們就說，今日必有風雨。

definition: wisps of blood/visible veins/(of eyes) bloodshot
to have a high temperature/feverish/unable to think calmly/to emit heat
lit. doesn't hurt, doesn't tickle (idiom); sth is wrong, but not quite sure what/fig. not getting to any matter of substance/scratching the surface/superficial/perfunctory
